Description: Fragment of wall of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater. Head and chest of a wreathed youth, frontal with head facing right. Drapery over 1eft arm. Added white paint on wreath.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College Dublin, Department of Classics, Classical Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Attributed by Vickers to the Pronomos Painter, though details of drawing do not seem to be his.
Bibliographic references: CVA UCD & UCC / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Ireland, Fascicule 1: University College Dublin, University College Cork (p. 41, pl. 30, 3)
Vickers 1971 / Some Unpublished Sherds from Naukratis in Dublin (p. 118, no. 17, pl. 14.Q)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1151)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: AN1896-1908-G.138.49 (old Ashmolean Museum accession number)
